00013 Map::Map()
00014 :obstacle_manager(NULL)
00015 {
00016         /* Assume that all tiles are 32x32, but can be overridden */
00017         tile_w = 32;
00018         tile_h = 32;

00021 
00022 Map::~Map()
00023 {
00024         obstacle_manager->Remove_obstacle(&obstacle_map);
00025         Entities entities = Container::Get_entities();
00026         for (Entities::iterator i = entities.begin(); i!=entities.end(); ++i)
00027         {
00028                 if ((*i)->Is_solid())
00029                 {
00030                         obstacle_manager->Remove_obstacle((*i));
00031                 }
00032         }
00033 }

00036 void Map::Load_Dimensions(std::ifstream& data)
00037 {
00038         Attributes attributes;
00039 
00040         std::string line;
00041         while (seek_non_comment_line(data, line))
00042         {
00043                 if ("</map>" == line)
00044                 {
00045                         /* Used to only need to type attribute name once: prevents typos */
00046                         std::string attributeName;
00047 
00048                         if (attributes.end() != attributes.find("tile_width") &&
00049                             attributes.end() != attributes.find("tile_height"))
00050                         {
00051                                 Show_attributes(std::cout, attributes);
00052 
00053                                 attributeName = "tile_width";
00054                                 tile_w = String_to_type<int>(attributes[attributeName]);
00055                                 attributes.erase(attributeName);
00056 
00057                                 attributeName = "tile_height";
00058                                 tile_h = String_to_type<int>(attributes[attributeName]);
00059                                 attributes.erase(attributeName);
00060                         }
00061                         else
00062                         {
00063                                 Monday_out(WARNING_LEVEL, std::cout, "*WARNING: Didn't find both width and height.\n");
00064                         }
00065 
00066                         // Once the closing tag is found, do not scan the file any further.
00067                         break;
00068                 }
00069 
00070                 //Store name, value pair in attributes
00071                 std::string name;
00072                 std::vector<std::string> value;
00073 
00074                 /* Ensure that the line has a valid "name=value" pair, else we will
00075                  * see problems.
00076                  */
00077                 if (true == name_and_value(line, name, value))
00078                 {
00079                         /* Until we figure out how to have multiple values with the same
00080                          * name, we're only going to be able to take the first one...
00081                          */
00082                         attributes[name] = value[0];
00083                 }
00084                 else
00085                 {
00086                         /* If this fails, the line doesn't have a "name=value" pair.
00087                          * It's not an error we can't recover from, so this is where a
00088                          * warning can be displayed, if desired.
00089                          */
00090                         Monday_out(VERBOSE_LEVEL4, std::cout, "No attribute pair found: %s, %s", line.c_str(), name.c_str());
00091                 }
00092         }
00093 }

00095 
00096 void Map::Load(const std::string& filename, Obstacle_manager* iobstacle_manager,
00097                            Resource_manager& resource_manager, Entity_manager* entity_manager)
00098 {
00099         obstacle_manager = iobstacle_manager;
00100         //Todo: Make binary loading
00101         std::ifstream fs;
00102         fs.open(filename.c_str());
00103         mon_assert(fs.is_open() && "Could not open specified filename");
00104         Monday_out(VERBOSE_LEVEL3, std::cout, "Map:Load()\n\tFilename: \"%s\"\n", filename.c_str());
00105         while (!fs.eof())
00106         {
00107                 std::string line;
00108                 std::getline(fs, line);
00109                 if ("<map>" == line)
00110                 {
00111                         Monday_out(VERBOSE_LEVEL2, std::cout, "Loading tile dimensions\n");
00112                         Load_Dimensions(fs);
00113                 }
00114 
00115                 else if ("<layer>" == line)
00116                 {
00117                         Monday_out(VERBOSE_LEVEL2, std::cout, "Loading map layer\n");
00118                         Layer layer;
00119                         layer.Set_Dimensions(tile_w, tile_h);
00120                         layer.Load(fs, resource_manager);
00121                         layers.push_back(layer);
00122                 }
00123 
00124                 else if ("<obstaclemap>" == line)
00125                 {
00126                         Monday_out(VERBOSE_LEVEL2, std::cout, "Loading obstacle map\n");
00127                         obstacle_map.Set_Dimensions(tile_w, tile_h);
00128                         obstacle_map.Load(fs);
00129                         obstacle_manager->Add_obstacle(&obstacle_map);
00130                 }
00131 
00132                 else if ("<entity>" == line)
00133                 {
00134                         Monday_out(VERBOSE_LEVEL2, std::cout, "Loading entity data\n");
00135                         Entity* entity = entity_manager->Create_entity(this);
00136 
00137                         /* This must be set before Load() is called */
00138                         entity->Set_Dimensions(tile_w, tile_h);
00139                         entity->Load(fs);
00140                 }
00141         }
00142         fs.close();
00143 }

00146 void Map::Render(const Camera& camera)
00147 {
00148         for (Layers::iterator i = layers.begin(); i!=layers.end(); ++i)
00149         {
00150                 i->Render(camera);
00151         }
00152         Container::Render(camera);
00153 }

00169 void Map::Add_entity(Entity* entity)
00170 {
00171         Container::Add_entity(entity);
00172         if (entity->Is_solid())
00173         {
00174                 obstacle_manager->Add_obstacle(entity);
00175         }
00176 }
00177 
00178 
00179 void Map::Remove_entity(Entity* entity)
00180 {
00181         Container::Remove_entity(entity);
00182         if (entity->Is_solid())
00183         {
00184                 obstacle_manager->Remove_obstacle(entity);
00185         }
00186 }
